segments.text: How did your interview go ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Pretty well . I don't know if I'll get the promotion or not , but I feel good about it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If you get the promotion , what will your new title be ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If I get the promotion , I will be a senior engineer instead of an assistant engineer .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Will you get a pay-raise , too ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Whenever you are given added responsibilities , you should get a promotion .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That makes sense . Who interviewed you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My boss .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What kinds of questions did she ask you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She asked me about my ability to work in a team and what I thought a good boss should be .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The second one sounds rather difficult to answer . What did you tell her ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I told her that I'm an excellent team player and that a good boss should treat male and female employees equally .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Those are good answers . How did she react ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She told me that even when I become a senior engineer , I'll have to work with the assistant engineers as a team .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What do you think about her as a boss ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She's pretty easy to get along with . She listens to her employees and treats everyone equally .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You're lucky . Not everyone has such a great boss !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's true . She's highly esteemed among everyone at my company .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When you find out you get the promotion or not , let me know .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I will do .
segments.speaker: S2
